name: ImportProducts
auth_description: Requires a user of type `Employee` or `Api` with functionality `ImportProducts:None`

headers.name: EVA-User-Agent
headers.description: The user agent that is making these calls. Don't make this specific per device/browser but per application. This should be of the form: `MyFirstUserAgent/1.0.0`

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnitID
headers.description: The ID of the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnit-Query
headers.description: The query that selects the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-IDs-Mode
headers.description: The IDs mode to run this request in. Currently only `ExternalIDs` is supported.

request_samples.name: JSON
request_samples.sample:
{
  "AllowEmptyMedia": true,
  "CustomPropertyTypes": [
    {
      "CategoryID": "string",
      "CopyToParentProductPropertyTypeID": "string",
      "DataType": 3,
      "IndexType": 2,
      "IsArray": true,
      "ProductPropertyTypeID": "string"

  ],
  "DownloadImagesInBackground": true,

  "LayerName": "string",
  "MediaBlobCategory": "string",
  "Products": [

        "Products": [

            "re": "cursion"
          }
        ],
        "Property": "string"
      }
    }
  ],
  "RootLogicalLevel": "string",
  "SystemID": "string",
  "Type": 1,
  "WaitForProductComposition": true
}

C.name: CategoryID
C.description: The ID of the category the property belongs to. Defaults to `default`.

C.name: CopyToParentProductPropertyTypeID
C.description:
If provided, the values of this property will be copied to the provided property on the parent products.
This can be useful if you have a `clothing_color` property on the `color` logical level and would like to have an `available_colors` property on the root level that contains all the colors that are available for the product.
In that example the value of the CopyToParentProductPropertyTypeID on the `clothing_color` property would be `available_colors` and the value of the CopyToParentProductPropertyTypeID on the `available_colors` property would be null.
If there is no property yet with this name, it will be automatically created with the same data type as the source property.

If there already exists a property with this name, the data type must match the data type of the source property and the IsArray property must be true as the parent products will be given multiple values from their children.

C.name: DataType
C.description:
Defines the data type of the property value.
Possible values:

* `0` - String
* `1` - Int
* `2` - Double
* `3` - Bool
* `4` - Date

C.name: IndexType
C.description:
Defines whether and how the property is indexed for search. This is a flags enum, so you can combine IndexedNotAnalyzed and IndexedAnalyzed to index both exact and analyzed variants.
Flags enum, combine any of the below values:

* `0` - NotIndexed
* `1` - IndexedNotAnalyzed
* `2` - IndexedAnalyzed

C.name: IsArray
C.description: Determines whether the property accepts multiple values (array) or a single value.

C.name: ProductPropertyTypeID
C.description: The ID of the custom property, typically in snake_case.

F.name: DeliveryOnly
F.description: Product is only available for delivery, not store pickup.

F.name: DisableBackorder
F.description: Product cannot be backordered when out of stock.

F.name: DisablePickup
F.description: Product cannot be picked up from a shop.

F.name: NonSellable
F.description: Indicates the product is not sellable.

F.name: PreRelease
F.description: Product is unavailable until the pre-order date.

F.name: UseUp
F.description: Indicates the product is end-of-life; remaining stock is final.

E.name: AnnouncementDate
E.description: Optional date when the product is announced for this assortment.

E.name: AssortmentCode
E.description: The backend code of the assortment this product should belong to.

E.name: EndDate
E.description: Optional date when the product stops being active in this assortment.

E.name: PreSaleDate
E.description: Optional date when the product becomes available for pre-sale.

E.name: ProductStatus
E.description: Status flags to apply for this product within the assortment.

E.name: ShipmentDate
E.description: Optional date when the product is expected to ship.

E.name: StartDate
E.description: Optional date when the product becomes active in this assortment.

H.name: ID
H.description: The unique identifier for the image. Optional; when null an ID is generated from the ImageUrl hash.

H.name: ImageData
H.description: Raw image bytes. Required only if ImageUrl is not provided.

H.name: ImageUrl
H.description: Where the image can be downloaded from. Required unless ImageData is provided.

H.name: IsPrimaryImage
H.description: When true, marks this image as the primary image for the product. If multiple images are marked, the last one wins.

H.name: LocationType
H.description: Storage location type override. Usually left empty to use defaults.

H.name: MimeType
H.description: The image MIME type. Optional; when null it will be inferred from the ImageUrl.

H.name: Name
H.description: Human-readable display name for the image. Optional; defaults to the image ID.

H.name: Sequence
H.description:
Sequence number used for ordering images and determining the primary image.
Smaller numbers mean higher priority. If null, ordering follows the Images array.
Only relative order matters: sequences 1, 2, 4, 7 will be stored as 0, 1, 2, 3.

I.name: ID
I.description: The unique identifier for the media item. Optional; when null an ID is generated from the MediaUrl hash.

I.name: IsPrimaryImage
I.description: When true, marks this media item as the primary image for the product. If multiple items are marked, the last one wins. Ignored for non-image/video media types.

I.name: LocationType
I.description: Storage location type override. Usually left empty to use defaults.

I.name: MediaData
I.description: Raw media bytes. Required only if MediaUrl is not provided.

I.name: MediaUrl
I.description: Where the media can be downloaded from. Required unless MediaData is provided.

I.name: MimeType
I.description: The media MIME type. Optional; when null it will be inferred from the MediaUrl.

I.name: Name
I.description: Human-readable display name for the media item. Optional; defaults to the media ID.

I.name: Sequence
I.description:
Sequence number used for ordering media and determining the primary image.
Smaller numbers mean higher priority. If null, ordering follows the Media array.
Only relative order matters: sequences 1, 2, 4, 7 will be stored as 0, 1, 2, 3.

J.name: PropertyName
J.description: The name of the dimension property (e.g., 'Width', 'Height').

J.name: Value
J.description: The dimension value, expressed as a string to preserve formatting or units.

G.name: CountryID
G.description:
Optional country for this content block. Leave null for country-agnostic content.

This is the ID of a `Country`

This string must be between 2 (incl) and 2 (incl) characters long.

G.name: CustomContent
G.description: Custom content values keyed by property ID, used for arbitrary content data.

G.name: Images
G.deprecation_notice:
**Deprecated since 812:** Images is deprecated and will be removed in 2.0.856: Use Media instead.

**Will be removed in 838**
G.description:
Deprecated list of product images. Use Media instead.

**Deprecated since 812:** Images is deprecated and will be removed in 2.0.856: Use Media instead.

**Will be removed in 838**

G.name: LanguageID
G.description:
Optional language for this content block. Leave null for language-agnostic content.

This is the ID of a `Language`

This string must be between 2 (incl) and 2 (incl) characters long.

G.name: LongDescription
G.description: Long-form description, typically used on the product detail page.

G.name: MarketingDescription
G.description: Marketing-focused description used in merchandising contexts.

G.name: Media
G.description: List of product media items (images, videos, etc.).

G.name: Name
G.description: Display name of the product for this language/country.

G.name: PublicationStatuses
G.description: Publication statuses that determine visibility. A product is generally not visible to non-employee users unless it includes a 'public' status.

G.name: ShortDescription
G.description: Short description, typically used in listings or quick views.

G.name: Tags
G.description: Tags used for filtering or merchandising.

G.name: UniqueSellingPointBlobIDs
G.description: Blob IDs for unique selling point assets (images, icons, etc.).

G.name: UniqueSellingPointTexts
G.description: Unique selling point text entries for this content block.

G.name: XDimension
G.description: Optional X-dimension metadata for the product (e.g., width).

G.name: YDimension
G.description: Optional Y-dimension metadata for the product (e.g., height).

K.name: BackendID
K.description: Optional backend identifier for external systems.

K.name: DataType
K.description:
The data type expected for this requirement.
Possible values:

* `0` - String
* `1` - Bool
* `2` - Integer
* `3` - Decimal
* `4` - Enum
* `5` - Text

K.name: EnumValues
K.description: Optional enumeration values keyed by value with display text as the value.

K.name: Handler
K.description: Optional handler name that processes the requirement value.

K.name: IsArray
K.description: When true, the requirement accepts multiple values.

K.name: IsRequired
K.description: When true, the requirement must be provided to complete the order.

K.name: Name
K.description: The display name of the requirement presented to the customer.

K.name: OrderType
K.description:
Optional order type this requirement applies to.
Possible values:

* `0` - Sales
* `1` - Purchase

M.name: AllowCustomPricing
M.description: Indicates whether custom pricing is allowed.

M.name: BundleProduct
M.description: Indicates the product is a bundle.

M.name: Event
M.description: An event product intended for scheduling appointments.

M.name: Insurance
M.description: Indicates the product is an insurance product.

M.name: NotReturnable
M.description: A product that cannot be returned.

M.name: Service
M.description: A non-physical product that represents a service.

M.name: Stock
M.description: A normal stock-keeping product. This is the default when no type is specified.

M.name: SubscriptionProduct
M.description: Indicates the product is a subscription.

M.name: VirtualProduct
M.description: Indicates the product is virtual and has no physical form.

N.name: Barcode
N.description: The barcode value. Must be unique.

N.name: Quantity
N.description: The quantity of product (in the specified unit of measure) represented by this barcode.

N.name: UnitOfMeasureID
N.deprecation_notice:
**Deprecated since 812:** UnitOfMeasureID is deprecated and will be removed in 2.0.856: Use UnitOfMeasureName instead.

**Will be removed in 838**
N.description:
The unit of measure ID for this barcode. If not specified, 'Each' is used. Must exist beforehand.

This is the ID of a `UnitOfMeasure`

**Deprecated since 812:** UnitOfMeasureID is deprecated and will be removed in 2.0.856: Use UnitOfMeasureName instead.

**Will be removed in 838**

N.name: UnitOfMeasureName
N.description: The unit of measure name for this barcode. If not specified, 'Each' is used. Must exist beforehand.

L.name: Assortments
L.description: If specified this will add the product to those assortments.

L.name: Barcodes
L.description: An (optional) list of barcodes for this product. A barcode should be globally unique and any duplicate barcodes will result in an error.

L.name: Brand
L.description:
The (optional) brand of the product. Only has to be specified on the root level of a hierarchy.

This string must be between 2 (incl) and 100 (incl) characters long.

L.name: Content
L.description:
The per-language content of the product.

A small set of default properties has been defined, such as Name and MarketingDescription. Additional content can be defined inside `CustomContent`, which is a key-value container
where the key is the name of a property and value should be a single scalar value (string, number, boolean or null) or an array of values.

If LanguageID is left null, this will be the fallback content for languages that have no content of their own.
For example, you may offer a French website but you only have English product content, if you specify your English content with LanguageID = null
then products on the French website will have the English content.

In general, it's a good idea to choose a language that will serve as the default fallback language and to not specify LanguageID for that language's content so it will function as the fallback content.

L.name: CountryOfOriginID
L.description: The country of origin for the product. Value must conform to the 2-letter country code as defined by ISO 3166-1.

L.name: CustomID
L.description:
The custom identifier for the product.

This string must be between 2 (incl) and 128 (incl) characters long.

L.name: ID
L.description:
The unique identifier for the product.

This string must be between 2 (incl) and 128 (incl) characters long.

L.name: IsDeleted
L.description: Set to `True` to delete the product.

L.name: LedgerClassID
L.description:
The (optional) ledger class ID of the product. Only has to be specified on the root level of a hierarchy.

This string must be between 1 (incl) and 10 (incl) characters long.

L.name: ManufacturerID
L.description: Optional field that can be used to store the manufacturer's identifier for this product.

L.name: Name
L.description:
The culture independent name of the product by which it can be recognized even if it otherwise does not have any content. Required unless Type = ContentOnly.

This string must be between 2 (incl) and 255 (incl) characters long.

L.name: Status
L.description: Defines the status of a product.

L.name: Type
L.description: Defines what kind of product it is. If the product is part of a hierarchy, this is only relevant for the SKU level, all other levels will have type Configurable.

L.name: UnitBarcodes
L.description: An (optional) list of barcodes with the associated quantity and unit of measure for this product. A barcode should be globally unique and any duplicate barcodes will result in an error.

O.name: CountryID
O.description:
Optional. Leave null if the variation value is not country-specific.

This is the ID of a `Country`

This string must be between 2 (incl) and 2 (incl) characters long.

O.name: LanguageID
O.description:
Optional. Leave null if the variation value is not language-specific.

This is the ID of a `Language`

This string must be between 2 (incl) and 2 (incl) characters long.

O.name: Value
O.description:
The actual value for the variation (e.g., 'XL', 'BLUE').

**Required since 812:** Field Value is required and will be enforced as such in 2.0.856.

**Will be enforced in 838**

P.name: LogicalLevel
P.description:
The LogicalLevel of a product defines the 'level' on which the product can be thought to sit in the hierarchy.

For example, the various different colors of a shirt can be thought to have LogicalLevel = 'color' and the actual SKU might have LogicalLevel = 'size' or 'sku'.

You are free to use any value, but keep it consistent within a product family. This helps frontends group levels (e.g., filter on color and then show sizes on the detail page).

P.name: Products
P.description: The collection of products that represent the variations at the specified LogicalLevel.

P.name: Property
P.description: The property on which the product hierarchy varies, e.g. 'size' or 'color'.

D.name: Assortments
D.description: If specified this will add the product to those assortments.

D.name: Barcodes
D.description: An (optional) list of barcodes for this product. A barcode should be globally unique and any duplicate barcodes will result in an error.

D.name: Brand
D.description:
The (optional) brand of the product. Only has to be specified on the root level of a hierarchy.

This string must be between 2 (incl) and 100 (incl) characters long.

D.name: CommodityCode
D.description: The CommodityCode is used for customs declarations and product tariffs. Can be used to store the HS code of the product.

D.name: Content
D.description:
The per-language content of the product.

A small set of default properties has been defined, such as Name and MarketingDescription. Additional content can be defined inside `CustomContent`, which is a key-value container
where the key is the name of a property and value should be a single scalar value (string, number, boolean or null) or an array of values.

If LanguageID is left null, this will be the fallback content for languages that have no content of their own.
For example, you may offer a French website but you only have English product content, if you specify your English content with LanguageID = null
then products on the French website will have the English content.

In general, it's a good idea to choose a language that will serve as the default fallback language and to not specify LanguageID for that language's content so it will function as the fallback content.

D.name: CountryOfOriginID
D.description: The country of origin for the product. Value must conform to the 2-letter country code as defined by ISO 3166-1.

D.name: CustomID
D.description:
The custom identifier for the product.

This string must be between 2 (incl) and 128 (incl) characters long.

D.name: GiftCardConfigurationID
D.description:
In case a type GiftCard product is uploaded, its `GiftCardType` or `GiftCardConfigurationID` is mandatory to connect to its provider.

This is the ID of a `GiftCardConfiguration`

D.name: GiftCardData
D.description: In case a type GiftCard product is uploaded, this defines the optional data for configuration.

D.name: GiftCardIsDigital
D.description: In case a type GiftCard product is uploaded, this defines if the product is digital, so it will not require a serialnumber during checkout.

D.name: GiftCardType
D.description: In case a type GiftCard product is uploaded, its `GiftCardType` or `GiftCardConfigurationID` is mandatory to connect to its provider.

D.name: ID
D.description:
The unique identifier for the product.

This string must be between 2 (incl) and 128 (incl) characters long.

D.name: ImagesWillBeInheritedByChildren
D.deprecation_notice:
**Deprecated since 812:** ImagesWillBeInheritedByChildren is deprecated and will be removed in 2.0.856: Use MediaWillBeInheretedByChildren.

**Will be removed in 838**
D.description:
Determines whether or not any images set on a parent product will inherit down to its children. This defaults to true.
Can be useful to give the root product of a hierarchy an ensemble of the available colors, without inheriting these images to the children.

**Deprecated since 812:** ImagesWillBeInheritedByChildren is deprecated and will be removed in 2.0.856: Use MediaWillBeInheretedByChildren.

**Will be removed in 838**

D.name: IsDeleted
D.description: Set to `True` to delete the product.

D.name: LedgerClassID
D.description:
The (optional) ledger class ID of the product. Only has to be specified on the root level of a hierarchy.

This string must be between 1 (incl) and 10 (incl) characters long.

D.name: ManufacturerID
D.description: Optional field that can be used to store the manufacturer's identifier for this product.

D.name: MediaWillBeInheritedByChildren
D.description:
Determines whether or not any media set on a parent product will inherit down to its children. This defaults to true.
Can be useful to give the root product of a hierarchy an ensemble of the available colors, without inheriting the media items to the children.

D.name: Name
D.description:
The culture independent name of the product by which it can be recognized even if it otherwise does not have any content. Required unless Type = ContentOnly.

This string must be between 2 (incl) and 255 (incl) characters long.

D.name: ProductRequirements
D.description: Optional field to set up the product requirements on a product.

D.name: RequireSerialNumberForSale
D.description:
Optional field to indicate a serialnumber will be required when selling this product.

- Will set the serial number configuration of the product to the default configuration, but only if not already set
- Use `SerialNumberConfigurationID` for more control
- Omitting both this field and `SerialNumberConfigurationID` will remove any serial number configuration from the product

D.name: SerialNumberConfigurationID
D.description:
Optional field to indicate what kind of serial number requirements apply to this product.

- Will overwrite the serial number configuration of the product with this specified value, taking precedence over `RequireSerialNumberForSale`
- Omitting both this field AND `RequireSerialNumberForSale` will remove any serial number configuration from the product

This is the ID of a `SerialNumberConfiguration`

D.name: Status
D.description: Defines the status of a product.

D.name: TaxCode
D.description:
The TaxCode determines how sales tax applies to this product. This must refer to an existing TaxCode in EVA, if it doesn't exist yet an error is returned.

Required unless Type = ContentOnly.

The string expected here is the Name property of the tax code, so 'High' for TaxCode High.

EVA defines the following default tax codes:

- High
- Intermediate
- Low
- Zero
- Exempt

In a hierarchy, the TaxCode only has to be specified for the root level; all products part of the hierarchy will always have the same TaxCode.

This string must be between 1 (incl) and 100 (incl) characters long.

D.name: Type
D.description: Defines what kind of product it is. If the product is part of a hierarchy, this is only relevant for the SKU level, all other levels will have type Configurable.

D.name: UnitBarcodes
D.description: An (optional) list of barcodes with the associated quantity and unit of measure for this product. A barcode should be globally unique and any duplicate barcodes will result in an error.

D.name: VariationValues
D.description:
Defines the per-language value of the variation property for this product. For example, if the variation property is `color` then the value could be 'red' or 'blue'.

If the variation value isn't language sensitive then the LanguageID should be left null. If there isn't an item where LanguageID is null, all languages for which this product has content must have
a value for the variation property.

D.name: Variations
D.description: Defines the variations hierarchy of the product.

B.name: AllowEmptyMedia
B.description: When true, and no media is supplied in the request, existing media on the product will be cleared.

B.name: CustomPropertyTypes
B.description: Optional definitions for custom properties referenced in product content. Use this to create or configure properties on-the-fly.

B.name: DownloadImagesInBackground
B.deprecation_notice:
**Deprecated since 812:** DownloadImagesInBackground is deprecated and will be removed in 2.0.856: Use DownloadMediaInBackground.

**Will be removed in 838**
B.description:
Deprecated. When not specified or explicitly false, images are downloaded during the request and may extend execution time. Defaults to true.

**Deprecated since 812:** DownloadImagesInBackground is deprecated and will be removed in 2.0.856: Use DownloadMediaInBackground.

**Will be removed in 838**

B.name: DownloadMediaInBackground
B.description: When not specified or explicitly false, media is downloaded during the request and may extend execution time. Defaults to true.

B.name: ImageBlobCategory
B.deprecation_notice:
**Deprecated since 812:** ImageBlobCategory is deprecated and will be removed in 2.0.856: Use MediaBlobCategory.

**Will be removed in 838**
B.description:
A string that identifies the storage category for product images. Optional; when omitted the SystemID is used instead.

This string must be between 2 (incl) and 50 (incl) characters long.

**Deprecated since 812:** ImageBlobCategory is deprecated and will be removed in 2.0.856: Use MediaBlobCategory.

**Will be removed in 838**

B.name: LayerName
B.description:
The layer on which the content will be stored. Defaults to 'ImportProducts-Base'. If you want to store the content on a different layer, you can specify it here. If the content also
specifies a language/country this will be combined with the provided layer name to create a layer name like '<name> <language> <country>', so the provided LayerName is not necessarily the absolute
value that is used for the layer, only if you leave LanguageID/CountryID as null on the content.

B.name: MediaBlobCategory
B.description:
A string that identifies the storage category for product media. Optional; when omitted the SystemID is used instead.

This string must be between 2 (incl) and 50 (incl) characters long.

B.name: Products
B.description: The list of products to create or update. If a product does not exist it is created; if a product with the same ID and SystemID exists it is updated.

B.name: RootLogicalLevel
B.description:
The LogicalLevel that will be assigned to root products in the hierarchy. If not specified, a default value is used.

See ProductVariation.LogicalLevel for more information.

B.name: SystemID
B.description:
A string that identifies the upstream system calling this service. Together with a product's ID, this uniquely identifies the product in EVA.
The SystemID must remain consistent across calls; changing it will cause new products to be created instead of updated.

This string must be between 2 (incl) and 50 (incl) characters long.

B.name: Type
B.description:
Controls how the import is executed (normal, content-only, or preview-only).
Possible values:

* `0` - Normal
* `1` - ContentOnly
* `2` - PreviewOnly

B.name: WaitForProductComposition
B.description:
By default the service only blocks long enough to store the requested modifications; additional processing continues asynchronously.
When set to true, the service blocks until the full product composition process is complete.

R.name: Code
R.description: A unique ID identifying this error.

R.name: Message
R.description: A human-readable message describing the error.

R.name: RequestID
R.description: A unique ID identifying the request. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

R.name: Type
R.description: A short description of the error type.

S.name: ExternalIDs
S.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the resolved external IDs.

S.name: IsAsyncResultAvailable
S.description: This is a flag indicating whether the async request is done. If it is `null`, it is not an async service. If it is `false`, the response is not yet available. Do not process the properties in that case. It is is `true` the properties are filled with the result of the call.

S.name: UnresolvedExternalIDs
S.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the external IDs we couldn't resolve.

T.name: BackendID
T.description: This is the ID of a `Product`

T.name: ID
T.description: This is the ID of a `Product`

Q.name: CreatedProductIDs
Q.description:
The EVA IDs of products that were newly created by this call.

This is the ID of a `Product`

Q.name: PreviewResult
Q.description: If the request Type was PreviewOnly, this contains the generated product structure preview.

Q.name: ProductMap
Q.description: Mapping entries from each input product ID to its internal EVA integer ID.

Q.name: UpdatedProductIDs
Q.description:
The EVA IDs of products that were updated by this call.

This is the ID of a `Product`
